      • getSessionProperties

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getSessionProperties()
        Return the session properties as provided by the server. The session properties are only valid if the connection is in the state ConnectionState.BOUND
        Returns:
        the connection properties

      • addPrivilegeListener

        void addPrivilegeListener(PrivilegeListener listener)
        Add a listener to the privileges of the session

        When adding a new listener it will receive an initial call with the current privileges.

        Parameters:
        listener -

      • getPrivileges

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getPrivileges()
        Return the list of currently granted privileges.
        Returns:
        the list of current privileges. Must never return null.
        Since:
        1.0

      • dispose

        void dispose()
        Dispose the connection

        A dispose will also act as a disconnect.

        Connections must be disposed in order to clean up all resources. In the past the disconnect() call was enough and, if possible, most resources (sockets) should be closed when disconnecting. Still some resources can be re-used and these need to be cleaned up in the dispose() call.

        Since:
        1.0
